main event: Multiple sightings of unidentified flying objects (UFOs) were reported over New York, New York, in July 1952, involving observations of bright, circular, and cigar-shaped objects moving at high speeds and displaying characteristics consistent with intelligent control.
interesting points: One witness observed several unidentified flying objects traveling in a scattered formation at a high rate of speed and estimated their diameter to be between 15 to 20 feet.

A luminous object, approximately 15-20 feet in diameter, was observed near Roosevelt Field, New York, moving at a relatively slow speed and displaying intelligent control according to the witness, who was a member of the Armed Forces.
Multiple witnesses observed a large, glowing, circular object in the sky over New York City, estimated to be approximately 60-100 feet in diameter and surrounded by a halo of light.

A witness, driving near 77th Street and Amsterdam Avenue in New York, observed a bright, circular object that moved rapidly in a zig-zag pattern before ascending rapidly out of sight. The witness reported the sighting to the United States Air Force.

A report was received from two observers, a cook and a bar tender, who described observing a round, silvery object giving off a bright light and moving at a rapid rate of speed across the sky before suddenly disappearing. They had observed a similar object about 2 weeks prior to the sighting.
sighted object: multiple unidentified flying objects (UFOs) including bright, circular, and cigar-shaped objects
witnesses: multiple credible witnesses including military personnel and civilians
